block_comment: This block of code relates to error handling in a "read only" port situation in a Verilog hardware design. When port 3, denoted by "C_PORT_CONFIG[87:64]" is configured for 32-bit reads ("R32") and a command is enabled via "p3_cmd_en" with a certain instruction set ("p3_cmd_instr[2]" and "p3_cmd_instr[0]"), the system performs an error check. If the conditions are met, the code displays an error message ("ERROR - Invalid Command for read only port 3") and terminates the program execution using "$finish". The `always @(*)` syntax denotes that the block will always execute upon any change in the inputs.
